page.title: 08THE WORTHING POOR HOUSE
page.content: The building was built in 1618,it was originally a workhouse where the men came to bake bread and the go off to work.There is a large fireplace in the main room which Mr.Stepney,the owner, uncovered not long ago. Some of the brickwork is Victorian but quite a bit is original.In the living-room,the ceiling has been uplifted.The floor is still original but the stairs are Victorian.In the kitchen,some beams have been replaced. Upstairs are only two rooms and the floor is only 3.75cm thick.The roof was originaly thatched,but now is slate. The kitchen is quite small but Mr. Stepney has modernized it.A door off the kitchen leads into the bathroom. The main bedroom has a blocked-off fireplace.Its chimney joins the main chimney.
